title: Invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference on 2.49.1
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2.49.1-stable. Pre-built binary

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash: 205eeda01fd8f8a2956276d6760b9298f70bd18f

Erigon Command (with flags/config): erigon --chain=mainnet  --pprof --rpc.gascap 500000000 --nat=stun  --authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 --authrpc.vhosts=* --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.corsdomain * --http.port 8545 --http.api eth,trace,net,engine,web3 --http.vhosts * --port 30303 --maxpeers 50 --txpool.nolocals --txpool.accountslots 32 --txpool.globalslots 8192 --txpool.accountqueue 128 --txpool.globalqueue 2048 --txpool.lifetime 3h0m0s --datadir /mnt/local/ethereum --ws    --authrpc.jwtsecret /mnt/local/ethereum/engine-jwt.key

Concensus Layer: Teku 23.9.0

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config): teku --log-destination=console --data-base-path=/mnt/local/ethereum --network=mainnet --ee-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --eth1-endpoint=http://localhost:8545 --ee-jwt-secret-file=/mnt/local/ethereum/engine-jwt.key --rest-api-enabled=true --rest-api-host-allowlist=* --rest-api-interface=0.0.0.0 --rest-api-port=5051 --metrics-enabled=true --metrics-host-allowlist=* --metrics-interface=0.0.0.0 --metrics-port=8008 --metrics-block-timing-tracking-enabled=true

Chain/Network: Ethereum mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

Erigon doesn't crash and syncs to head.

#### Actual behaviour

Erigon crashes with:

```
Sep 15 15:15:05 ip-10-0-69-130 erigon[407070]: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
Sep 15 15:15:05 ip-10-0-69-130 erigon[407070]: [signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x14e1a87]
```

In this case there's a number of warnings beforehand about a timestamp discrepancy between the index file and segment file, and other errors, as seen in this log excerpt leading up to the panic:

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
